snippet: At least 23 people were killed in the bombings in Ndjamena, and the president’s office said the Nigerian terrorist group Boko Haram was to blame.
abstract: Four suicide bombers strike Police Headquarters and training academy in capital city of Ndjamena, Chad, killing 23 other people, and wounding 101; attack is believed to be retaliation by Boko Haram.
lead_paragraph: At least 23 people were killed in the bombings in Ndjamena, and the president’s office said the Nigerian terrorist group Boko Haram was to blame.

headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Africa; Chad: Suicide Bombers Strike Police Targets in Capital
